## DynamodbDocumentClient

A wrapper around AWS.DynamoDB.DocumentClient to simplify interactions

### Parameters

- `options` **[Object][66]** See below
  - `options.table` **[string][67]** The DynamoDB table name
  - `options.name` **[string][67]** The name to be used for the 'client' property on the logger
    (optional, default `'dynamodb-document'`)
  - `options.hashKey` **[string][67]** The DynamoDB table hash key.
  - `options.rangeKey` **[string][67]** The DynamoDB table range key (if set).
  - `options.reqId` **[string][67]** The reqId used for distributed log tracing (optional, default
    `uuidv4()`)
  - `options.log` **[Object][66]** A pino compatible logger (optional, default `createLogger()`)
  - `options.params` **[Object][66]** Additional parameters to the AWS.S3 constructor 'params'
    property (optional, default `{}`)

## LambdaClient

A wrapper around AWS.Lambda to simplify interactions

### Parameters

- `options` **[Object][66]** See below
  - `options.arn` **[string][67]** The ARN of the lambda to invoke
  - `options.name` **[string][67]** The name to be used for the 'client' property on the logger
    (optional, default `'lambda'`)
  - `options.reqId` **[string][67]** The reqId used for distributed log tracing (optional, default
    `uuidv4()`)
  - `options.log` **[Object][66]** A pino compatible logger (optional, default `createLogger()`)
  - `options.params` **[Object][66]** Additional parameters to the AWS.Lambda constructor 'params'
    property (optional, default `{}`)

### invokeJson

Invoke the lambda

#### Parameters

- `payload` **[Object][66]** The object to pass as the Payload for lambdaClient.invoke
- `params` **[Object][66]** Additional properties to the lambdaClient.invoke method (optional,
  default `{}`)

Returns **any** The JSON parsed response from lambdaClient.invoke

## S3Client

A wrapper around AWS.S3 to simplify interactions

### Parameters

- `options` **[Object][66]** See below
  - `options.bucket` **[string][67]** The s3 Bucket
  - `options.name` **[string][67]** The name to be used for the 'client' property on the logger
    (optional, default `'s3'`)
  - `options.reqId` **[string][67]** The reqId used for distributed log tracing (optional, default
    `uuidv4()`)
  - `options.log` **[Object][66]** A pino compatible logger (optional, default `createLogger()`)
  - `options.params` **[Object][66]** Additional parameters to the AWS.S3 constructor 'params'
    property (optional, default `{}`)

### getObjectJson

getObject from S3 Bucket

#### Parameters

- `key` **[Object][66]** The key to pass as the Key for s3Client.getObject
- `params` **[Object][66]** Additional properties to the s3.getObject method (optional, default
  `{}`)

Returns **any** The JSON response from s3.getObject

## SqsSendMessageResponse

A basic POJO encapsulating sent message attributes

### Parameters

- `options` **[Object][66]**
  - `options.md5OfMessageBody` **[string][67]**
  - `options.messageId` **[string][67]**
  - `options.md5OfMessageAttributes` **[string][67]**
  - `options.sequenceNumber` **[number][68]**

### Properties

- `md5OfMessageBody` **[string][67]**
- `messageId` **[string][67]**
- `md5OfMessageAttributes` **[string][67]**
- `sequenceNumber` **[number][68]**

## SqsClient

A wrapper around AWS.SQS to simplify interactions

### Parameters

- `options` **[Object][66]** See below
  - `options.queueUrl` **[string][67]** The URL for the queue
  - `options.name` **[string][67]** The name to be used for the 'client' property on the logger
    (optional, default `'sqs'`)
  - `options.reqId` **[string][67]** The reqId used for distributed log tracing (optional, default
    `uuidv4()`)
  - `options.log` **[Object][66]** A pino compatible logger (optional, default `createLogger()`)
  - `options.params` **[Object][66]** Additional parameters to the AWS.Lambda constructor 'params'
    property (optional, default `{}`)

### publishJson

Publish a message to SQS that will be JSON

#### Parameters

- `body` **[Object][66]** The message body to be sent to SQS
- `params` **[Object][66]** Additional properties to the sqsClient.sendMessage method (optional,
  default `{}`)

Returns **[SqsSendMessageResponse][69]** Information about the message sent

## AppContext

The runtime context

### Parameters

- `options` **[Object][66]** See below
  - `options.awsRequestId` **[string][67]** The awsRequestId for the current invocation
  - `options.eventType` **[string][67]** A string representing the type of event
  - `options.functionName` **[string][67]** The name of the lambda function from lambda context
  - `options.log` **[object][66]** A pino compatible logger
  - `options.reqId` **[string][67]** The distributed tracing id for this invocation

### Properties

- `awsRequestId` **[string][67]** The awsRequestId for the current invocation
- `eventType` **[string][67]** A string representing the type of event
- `functionName` **[string][67]** The name of the lambda function from lambda context
- `log` **[object][66]** A pino compatible logger
- `reqId` **[string][67]** The distributed tracing id for this invocation

## EventType

The different types of events that can occur

### Properties

- `cloudfront` **[string][67]**
- `awsConfig` **[string][67]**
- `codeCommit` **[string][67]**
- `apiGatewayAuthorizer` **[string][67]**
- `cloudFormation` **[string][67]**
- `ses` **[string][67]**
- `apiGatewayAwsProxy` **[string][67]**
- `scheduledEvent` **[string][67]**
- `cloudWatchLogs` **[string][67]**
- `sns` **[string][67]**
- `dynamoDb` **[string][67]**
- `kinesisFirehose` **[string][67]**
- `cognitoSyncTrigger` **[string][67]**
- `kinesis` **[string][67]**
- `s3` **[string][67]**
- `mobileBackend` **[string][67]**
- `sqs` **[string][67]**
- `lambda` **[string][67]**
- `isValid` **[Function][70]** Return true if provided value is a valid event type, false otherwise

## parser

Type: [Function][70]

### Parameters

- `event` **[Object][66]** The raw lambda event
- `context` **[Object][66]** The raw lambda context

Returns **any** The parsed event for the processor

## processor

Type: [Function][70]

### Parameters

- `parsedEvent` **any** The parsed event output from the `parser`

Returns **any** The serialized lambda response

## serializer

Type: [Function][70]

### Parameters

- `response` **any** The response from the handler to be serialized for lambda response

Returns **any** The serialized lambda response

## wrapper

Type: [Function][70]

### Parameters

- `response` **[processor][71]** The response from the handler to be serialized for lambda response

Returns **[Function][70]** The processor wrapped in any additional code you may want

## createContainer

Type: [Function][70]

### Parameters

- `appContext` **[AppContext][72]** The context for the current execution of the lambda
- `configuration` **[Object][66]** The configuration object from the passed configurationRequests

Returns **[Object][66]** All of the side effect dependencies in an object

## createProcessor

Type: [Function][70]

### Parameters

- `appContext` **[AppContext][72]** The context for the current execution of the lambda
- `container` **[Object][66]** The response from the createContainer invocation

Returns **[Object][66]** All of the side effect dependencies in an object

## createCache

Type: [Function][70]

Returns **cacheManager** An instance of cacheManager

## createWrapper

Type: [Function][70]

### Parameters

- `appContext` **[AppContext][72]** The context for the current execution of the lambda
- `parser` **[parser][73]** The parser provided to `createHandler`
- `serializer` **[serializer][74]** The serializer provided to `createHandler`

Returns **[wrapper][75]** All of the side effect dependencies in an object

## lambdaHandler

Type: [Function][70]

### Parameters

- `event` **[object][66]** The raw lambda event
- `context` **[object][66]** The raw lambda context

Returns **any** The result of the processor

## createHandler

The entry point for creating handlers

### Parameters

- `options` **[Object][66]** See below
  - `options.parser` **[parser][73]?** An optional function to parse the incoming lambda event
  - `options.serializer` **[serializer][74]?** An optional function to serialize the response from
    the lambda invocation
  - `options.configurationRequests` **[Array][76]&lt;ConfigurationRequest>** An array of
    configuration requests to be fulfilled before each invocation of the handler (optional, default
    `[]`)
  - `options.createContainer` **[createContainer][77]** A factory function that will return all
    needed side effect dependencies. Eg. Http (optional, default `()=>({})`)
  - `options.createCache` **[createCache][78]** An instance of cacheManager. Will be used to cache
    configuration. (optional, default `defaultCache`)
  - `options.createWrapper` **[createWrapper][79]** A factory function that will return the
    processor wrapped in additional functionality (optional, default `createDefaultWrapper`)
  - `options.createProcessor` **[createProcessor][80]** A factory function that will return the main
    handler for the lambda
  - `options.t` **any?** For use with AVA during testing

Returns **[lambdaHandler][81]** A lambda handler

## createJsonHandler

A handler designed for direct lambda invocations that respond with a JSON serializable object. Takes
identical options as createHandler, however the serializer and parser options will always be
overridden with the identity function.

### Parameters

- `options` **any** Takes identical options as createHandler, however the serializer and parser
  options will always be overridden with the identity function.

## createApiJsonHandler

A handler designed for lambda invocations through api gateway that respond with a JSON serializable
object. Takes identical options as createHandler, however the wrapper option will always be
overridden with the multi-status code version.

See the following:

- [createApiJsonWrapper][62]
- [multiStatusCodeJsonSerializer][58]
- [MultiStatusJsonResponse][56]

### Parameters

- `options` **any** Takes identical options as createHandler, however the wrapper option will always
  be overridden with the multi-status code version.

## parseJsonHttpEvent

This parse will handle the following:

- Body parsed into a json object
- HTTP method as a string
- Path parameters as key value pairs, properly decoded from uri
- Query string parameters as multi-value entries. Object&lt;string, Array<string>>

### Parameters

- `event` **[object][66]** An event from Api Gateway -> Lambda Proxy Integration

Returns **[HttpEvent][82]** The parsed event

## HttpEvent

Parse an HTTP Lambda event

### Parameters

- `options` **[Object][66]** See below
  - `options.body` **[Object][66]** The body of the event
  - `options.httpMethod` **[string][67]** String name of the http method
  - `options.pathParameters` **[Object][66]&lt;[string][67], [string][67]>** An object of path part
    name, value pairs
  - `options.queryStringParameters` **[Object][66]&lt;[string][67], [Array][76]&lt;[string][67]>>**
    An object of parameter name, array of values pairs

### Properties

- `body` **[Object][66]** The body of the event
- `httpMethod` **[string][67]** String name of the http method
- `pathParameters` **[Object][66]&lt;[string][67], [string][67]>** An object of path part name,
  value pairs
- `queryStringParameters` **[Object][66]&lt;[string][67], [Array][76]&lt;[string][67]>>** An object
  of parameter name, array of values pairs

## parseJsonMonoSqsEvent

Parse a Lambda SQS event

### Parameters

- `sqsEvent` **[Object][66]** A Lambda SQS event

Returns **[SqsEvent][83]** The parsed SQS event

## SqsEvent

An SQS Event

### Parameters

- `options` **[Object][66]** See below
  - `options.body` **[Object][66]** The body of the SQS event

### Properties

- `body` **[Object][66]** The body of the event

## MultiStatusJsonResponse

A json response with statusCode

### Parameters

- `$0` **[Object][66]**
  - `$0.statusCode`
  - `$0.body`
- `statusCode` **[number][68]** The statusCode of the response
- `body` **[Object][66]** The json object body of the response

## multiStatusCodeJsonSerializer

A serializer for handling statusCode and json object body responses

### Parameters

- `response` **[MultiStatusJsonResponse][84]** The result from processor
- `ctx` **[AppContext][72]** The context of the current execution

Returns **[Object][66]** Api gateway compatible response with statusCode, body, and headers set
appropriately

## createDefaultWrapper

A wrapper that handles top level logging/parsing/serialization orchestration

### Parameters

- `ctx` **[object][66]** Internal use
- `parser` (optional, default `event=>event`)
- `serializer` (optional, default `data=>data`)

Returns **[wrapper][75]** The wrapped processor

## createApiJsonWrapper

A processor that uses the provided parser and the multiStatusCodeJsonSerializer The response from
the process needs to be in the form: { statusCode: [number], data: [JSON serializable object] }

### Parameters

- `ctx` **[object][66]** Internal use
- `parser` (optional, default `event=>event`)
- `serializer` (optional, default `multiStatusCodeJsonSerializer`)

Returns **[wrapper][75]** The wrapped processor

## readJson

A method read a file from disk and parse it as JSON

### Parameters

- `args` **...any** The path as it would be provided to path.resolve

Returns **[Object][66]** The file contents parsed as JSON
